direction.direction_description: Chop vegetables.
Sauté sausage in a non-stick skillet.
Add onions and cook until translucent. Add consomme powder.
Add potatoes and water. Bring to a boil and season according to preference.
Once potatoes are tender, add kale. Simmer for 5 minutes then turn off heat.

ingredient.food_name: Dry Chicken Broth, Bouillion or Consomme
ingredient.ingredient_description: 3 tsps dry chicken broth, bouillion or consomme

recipes.recipe_description: An easy-to-prepare dish perfect for chilly nights.

direction.direction_description: Pre-heat oven at 350°F.
In a bowl mash bananas. Mix 1 egg, brown sugar, white sugar, butter, vanilla extract, and sour cream.
Add flour, salt, and baking soda.
To prepare the cream cheese filling, mix the remaining egg and cream cheese together.
Pour half of the banana batter into a greased 9" x 5" loaf pan, then pour the cream cheese over. Add the remaining of the batter on top.
Bake for 50 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Allow to cool for 15 minutes before serving.

recipes.recipe_description: A soft bread with salty-sweet taste, perfectly paired with coffee or tea.
recipes.recipe_name: Banana Bread with Cream Cheese Filling

direction.direction_description: Grind oats using a food processor.
Melt the chocolate with butter in the microwave.
Crush the walnuts.
Mix everything together. Stir well to avoid lumps. Transfer to a greased or parchment-lined dish.
Bake in pre-heated oven at 350°F for 50 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Let cool before slicing into squares.

ingredient.ingredient_description: 100 g organic pure dark 70% dark chocolate

recipes.recipe_description: A delicious snack without added refined sugar.

direction.direction_description: Whisk liquid egg whites and almond milk together.
Wash vegetables. Slice mushrooms and bell pepper.
Spray a pan with cooking spray. Mix all ingredients and pour in the pan.
Bake at pre-heated oven at 400°F for 30 minutes.

recipes.recipe_description: A healthy and tasty meal prep breakfast for the whole family.

direction.direction_description: Grind oats to powder using food processor.
Combine all ingredients until incorporated.
Scoop mixture to form balls. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.

ingredient.ingredient_description: 2 rounded scoops gold standard 100% whey - double rich chocolate

recipes.recipe_description: A no-bake snack perfect after workout.

Slice tomatoes and cheese.
Arrange tomatoes, basil, and cheese alternately around a plate. Drizzle with olive oil.

recipes.recipe_description: A simple yet elegant dish using only 4 ingredients.

direction.direction_description: Cut cucumbers into quarters and slice olives in halves.
On a plate, layer cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, tuna, and feta cheese.
Squeeze lemon and drizzle olive oil.

ingredient.food_name: Albacore Tuna in Water (No Salt Added)
ingredient.ingredient_description: 56.5 g albacore tuna in water (no salt added)

recipes.recipe_description: A no-fuss recipe for a healthy brunch.

direction.direction_description: Heat curry paste until oil is seeping. Add coconut milk unsweetened.
Add beef and cook until surface is brown.
Add the rest of coconut milk and some water to cover the meat. Cook until tender.
Add fish sauce, sugar, and bell pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl and garnish as desired.

recipes.recipe_description: A flavorful Asian dish perfect for dinner.

direction.direction_description: Sear tuna steaks on both sides until a little pink in the middle. Let cool before flaking.
Dice onion, celery, dill pickle, and hard boiled eggs.
Combine everything in a bowl and season with salt and pepper as desired.

recipes.recipe_description: A quick, low-carb meal prep dish for lunch.

direction.direction_description: Clean, rinse, and pat dry shrimp.
Transfer to a large bowl and toss with spices and salt.
Heat avocado oil in a skillet.
Add shrimp in batches and cook in a single layer for about 1 minute or until the edges have started to turn pink. Flip and cook the other side for another minute or so.
Transfer to a plate and squeeze lemon over. Top with fresh basil then serve.

recipes.recipe_description: A tasty seafood dish that's ready in less than 30 minutes.

direction.direction_description: Mix ingredients together in a bowl.
Scoop mixture and form meatballs.
Place meatballs in a greased or parchment lined tray.
Cook in pre-heated oven at 350°F for 25-35 minutes.

Combine with egg and flour
Cook in the waffle maker for 3-5 minutes until golden.
Transfer to a plate and serve with desired fruits.

recipes.recipe_description: A delightful, gluten-free breakfast using only 3 ingredients.

direction.direction_description: Blend all ingredients together.
Pour batter into lightly greased pan, forming a thin layer.
Cook for 30 seconds on each side until light brown.

ingredient.ingredient_description: 1 1/4 cups pure almond milk - unsweetened original

recipes.recipe_description: A dairy-free version of the classic dessert.

direction.direction_description: Mix dry ingredients.
Gradually add wet ingredients. Knead until incorporated.
Roll out the dough and cut into rounds using biscuit cutter.
Arrange in baking sheet and cook in pre-heated oven at 450°F for 10-15 minutes.

ingredient.food_name: Baking Powder (Sodium Aluminum Sulfate, Double Acting)
ingredient.ingredient_description: 8 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)

recipes.recipe_description: A low-sugar bread that is easy to prepare.

direction.direction_description: Slice steak and vegetables into thin slices.
Heat large pan with olive oil. Brown steak.
Add vegetables and seasonings. Cook until tender.
Remove pan from heat then serve.

recipes.recipe_description: A low-cholesterol, meat dish that's easy to prepare.

direction.direction_description: Pre-heat oven at 350°F.
Mash banana in a bowl. Finely chop walnuts. Mix together.
Add oats, vanilla, cinnamon, and salt.
Line baking tray with parchment paper. Measure out batter by tablespoons and flatten each into a round.
Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven then reduce temperature to 300°F. Flip cookies and bake for another 10 minutes. Let it cool in rack.

recipes.recipe_description: A healthy, easy to prepare treat that will satisfy your craving.

direction.direction_description: Combine flour, baking powder, and lard by hand until it is roughly the texture of cornmeal.
Add buttermilk and combine.
Roll out on a floured surface. Cut into 5 biscuits and dip in bacon grease.
Bake at 450°F for 20 minutes. Let it cool and serve.

ingredient.food_name: Baking Powder (Sodium Aluminum Sulfate, Double Acting)
ingredient.ingredient_description: 2 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)

recipes.recipe_description: Soft, homemade biscuits using only 5 ingredients.

direction.direction_description: Air fry bacon until crispy or desired texture is achieved.
Pan fry peppers until softened.
Slice green onions and measure out cheddar cheese.
Add all ingredients to mashed cauliflower.
Bake mashed cauliflower according to packaging directions or until cheese has melted.

recipes.recipe_description: A low carb dish that's great alternative for mashed potatoes.

direction.direction_description: Cut water spinach about 3-4 inches long. Soak in cold water. Rinse off after a couple of minutes.
Chop garlic and chili peppers. Slice mushrooms.
Sauté mushrooms in avocado oil until browned. Add garlic then chili peppers.
Add pork and water spinach. Mix until the greens are tender.
Add oyster sauce and soy sauce. Mix well but do not overcook.

recipes.recipe_description: A low calorie dish using simple ingredients.
recipes.recipe_name: Stir Fry Pork with Water Spinach

direction.direction_description: Blend all ingredients together (except oil, cherries, and honey) for 30 seconds or until incorporated.
Let sit for 2 minutes while pan is heating.
Add oil to the pan. Scoop 1/4 cup batter for each pancake. Cook for 2 mins on each side or until golden brown.
Top with cherries and honey.

ingredient.ingredient_description: 1/4 cup almond breeze unsweetened vanilla milk

ingredient.food_name: Baking Powder (Sodium Aluminum Sulfate, Double Acting)
ingredient.ingredient_description: 1 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)

recipes.recipe_description: A quick, dairy-free breakfast for kids and adults.

direction.direction_description: Peel and slice hard-boiled eggs.
Toast whole wheat bread.
Heat a pan and make the white sauce by melting butter, adding flour, and stirring in milk.
On the bread, add egg and white sauce. Top with cheese then serve.

ingredient.food_name: Milk (2% Lowfat with Added Vitamin A)

recipes.recipe_description: An American breakfast or brunch perfect for people on the go.

direction.direction_description: Slice bitter melon then massage with salt. Set aside for 5-10 minutes. Rinse with cold water then drain.
Chop garlic, shallots, and tomatoes. Slice the chicken in cubes.
Sauté garlic, shallots, and tomatoes in a non-stick pan.
Adjust the heat to high then add chicken. When the chicken is almost cooked, add a splash of water to prevent it from drying and clumping.
Season with fish sauce and black pepper.
Add the drained bitter melon and stir lightly. Cook for 2 minutes.
Beat the eggs in a bowl then add to the pan. Mix lightly until the egg is cooked. Turn off the heat and serve.

ingredient.measurement_description: medium breast (yield after cooking, bone removed)

recipes.recipe_description: A quick and tasty Filipino dish that is usually served with rice.

direction.direction_description: Mix the crab meat, egg, and egg yolk in a bowl.
Grease the pan with butter. Scoop the crab meat mixture and press to flatten.
Flip the cake to cook both sides until golden brown. Let it cool and serve.

recipes.recipe_description: A quick and delicious appetizer.

direction.direction_description: Dice onions and garlic. Chop mushrooms.
Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil until caramelized, then add mushrooms.
Add a cup of water and seasonings.
Cook down mixture and deglaze with wine.

Add pasta and enough water to cover it. Simmer on medium high heat. Note: Add water in small amounts as needed to cook pasta, but not too much to avoid making the sauce runny. Sauce should be a little thick when pasta is done.
Once the pasta is tender and the liquid is reduced, turn off heat then serve.

recipes.recipe_description: A flavorful, one-pot dish perfect for weeknight dinner.

direction.direction_description: Add chickpeas into a large bowl and cover with water. Drain the chickpeas and rinse under cold running water.

Add soaked chickpeas, chickpea flour, and seasonings into a food processor until well combined. Note: The texture of the chickpeas should be uneven and coarse with some slightly larger pieces still visible. The mixture should hold together when pressed it between fingers, but it shouldn't be completely puréed. If the mixture is too wet, add a little bit more chickpea flour. If it's too dry and crumbly, pulse it a little bit more.
Transfer the falafel mixture into a bowl, cover, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.

Scoop out 1-2 tablespoons of the mixture and roll it gently between hands into balls, approx. 1.5 inch in diameter. Avoid packing the balls too tightly or they will come out tough and dense. Repeat until all the falafel mixture is used up.
Preheat the air fryer to 370°F for 5 minutes.
Arrange the falafel balls in a single layer in the air fryer basket.
Cook for 13-15 minutes or until golden brown and crispy, then serve.

recipes.recipe_description: A Middle Eastern classic cooked in a healthier way.

direction.direction_description: Place potatoes in a medium saucepan and add cold water to cover by an inch. Bring to a boil, season with salt, and cook for 15−20 minutes or until tender. Transfer potatoes to a plate.
Return water to a boil and cook string beans for 2 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a bowl of ice water and chill for 3 minutes. Transfer to paper towels and pat dry.
Boil eggs for 8 minutes. Transfer eggs to a bowl of ice water and chill for 5 minutes. Peel and set aside.
Heat 2 tbsps. olive oil in a separate saucepan. Add capers and cook until crispy. Transfer capers to paper towels. Allow the remaining oil in the pan to cool and set aside.

Pre-heat oven to 425˚F. Rub salmon all over with reserved caper oil and place on a rimmed baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper. Roast for 10−12 minutes or until medium-rare (fish will be slightly translucent in the center). Let it cool and set aside.
To make the dressing, mash anchovies, mustard, and sugar in a large bowl to form a coarse paste.

Remove peel and white pith from lemon. Working over a bowl, cut between membranes of lemon to release segments. Squeeze remaining juice from membranes into bowl, then discard membranes. Add shallots, then slowly whisk in remaining olive oil.
Halve reserved potatoes and eggs crosswise. Arrange everything on a platter and drizzle with dressing.

ingredient.food_name: Anchovies - Flat Fillets in Olive Oil
ingredient.ingredient_description: 15 g anchovies - flat fillets in olive oil

recipes.recipe_description: A satisfying, complete meal that has balanced flavor.

direction.direction_description: Pre-heat oven to 375°F. Whisk flour, cinnamon, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in a medium bowl.
Mix carrot, egg, walnuts, oats, yogurt, coconut oil, pumpkin seeds, maple syrup, dried cranberries, flaxseeds, and 1/4 cup coconut flakes in a large bowl.
Add dry ingredients and mix well to incorporate.  Let sit for 10 minutes at room temperature to thicken slightly.

Transfer remaining coconut flakes to a medium bowl. Scoop 1/4 cup batter into the bowl of coconut flakes to coat.  Arrange coconut-coated batter in parchment-lined baking sheets, observing 2 inches gap in between.  Flatten each ball slightly.
Bake cookies for 15-17 minutes or until golden. Let it cool.
Store cookies in an airtight container for 4-6 days at room temperature or freeze for up to 3 months.

ingredient.food_name: Golden Roasted Flaxseed with Whole Seeds
ingredient.ingredient_description: 2 tbsps golden roasted flaxseed with whole seeds

ingredient.food_name: Baking Powder (Sodium Aluminum Sulfate, Double Acting)
ingredient.ingredient_description: 1/4 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)

recipes.recipe_description: A healthy, grab-and-go breakfast loaded with flavors.

direction.direction_description: Mix flour, baking powder, and salt into a large bowl. Add butter and mix. Gradually add sugar and cinnamon to incorporate.
Add cream, honey, and vanilla. Stir until a thick dough forms.
Roll out dough until about 1/2 inch thick. Cut into squares and make an 'X' across the top of each.
Bake at 425°F for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Let it cool and serve.

recipes.recipe_description: A special type of bread from a fictional story that is actually satisfying.

direction.direction_description: Clean and cut mushrooms. Sauté in 1 tbsp olive oil then push to the rim of the pot.
Finely chop onion and garlic then add to the center of the pot. Add another tablespoon of olive oil. Stir until both are cooked.
Hollow out the middle of the pot and add brown rice with remaining olive oil to toast. After a few minutes, deglaze pot by gradually pouring broth and wine. Add seasonings.
Allow liquid to reduce while simmering. Keep stirring until rice is fully cooked. Turn off heat and serve.

recipes.recipe_description: A vegan, gluten-free dish for weekend dinner.

direction.direction_description: Cook pasta according to packaging directions.
Chop vegetables and cheese.
Toss everything in a bowl and drizzle with dressing.

recipes.recipe_description: A delightful, low-calorie dish that is easy to prepare.

direction.direction_description: Cook elbow macaroni according to packaging directions. Make sure to let it cool under cold water.
Prepare vegetables and transfer to a bowl.
Mix macaroni, vegetables, and dressing. Serve.

ingredient.food_name: Italian Dressing (made with Vinegar and Oil)
ingredient.ingredient_description: 1/2 cup italian dressing (made with vinegar and oil)

recipes.recipe_description: A low-calorie salad packed with different vegetables.

direction.direction_description: Wash and chop fruits and vegetables. Store in the freezer for at least 1 hour.
Place everything (except bee pollen) in a blender and mix until smooth.
Transfer to a glass and top with bee pollen. Serve.

ingredient.food_name: Almond Breeze Original Unsweetened Non-Dairy Beverage

recipes.recipe_description: A dairy-free drink for that instant energy boost.

direction.direction_description: Whisk together applesauce, eggs, yogurt, and honey.
Blend dry ingredients. Stir into wet ingredients
Wash and chop apple. Add to mixture.
Scoop 1/4 cup into each section of cupcake pan.
Bake at 400°F for 13-15 minutes. Perform toothpick test. Let it cool and serve.

ingredient.food_name: Baking Powder (Sodium Aluminum Sulfate, Double Acting)
ingredient.ingredient_description: 5 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
2 scoops super advanced whey protein - vanilla

recipes.recipe_description: A yummy and moist bread perfect as post-workout snack.

direction.direction_description: Pre-heat oven to 375°F.
Mix wet ingredients. Slowly add flour and baking powder.
Place tablespoons of mixture into prepared madeleine moulds.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden and cakes spring back when pressed in the center. Cool on a wire rack then serve.

ingredient.food_name: Baking Powder (Sodium Aluminum Sulfate, Double Acting)
ingredient.ingredient_description: 2 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)

recipes.recipe_description: A classic French treat with light and chewy texture.

direction.direction_description: Pre-heat oven to 375°F. Mix dry ingredients together, making a well in the center.
Stir honey, oil, orange juice, eggs, and vanilla together.
Add honey mixture to dry ingredients. Mix well to combine.
Add carrots and raisins.
Spoon batter into muffin cups 2/3 full.
Bake for 20 minutes. Perform toothpick test. Let it cool then serve.

recipes.recipe_description: A tasty, dairy-free bread with diverse flavors.

direction.direction_description: Cook quinoa as directed on packaging. Let it cool.
Wash and dice all vegetables.
Open and rinse canned beans.
Mix quinoa, onions, beans, peppers, celery, and cilantro.
Slice and squeeze limes to get juice.
Make dressing by combining olive oil, red wine vinegar, lime juice, salt, sugar and spices. Pour over quinoa mixture then serve.

Toss gently and top with cheese .

Squeeze juice from fruits using juicer.
Divide juice into 12 oz jars.
Refrigerate.

Add oats until thick.
Add chocolate chips or other add-ins.
Bake at 350 on parchment paper for 15 minutes.

1 tbsp semi-sweet mini chocolate chip morsels

Add olive oil and toss to combine.
Line in baking sheet and cook for 30-40 minutes until squash is tender.

recipes.recipe_description: A tasty and easy to prepare dish for weekday dinner.

direction.direction_description: Chop onion and garlic. Sauté in pot with olive oil.
Add rice, tomato paste, and seasonings.
Add water and stir until tomato paste is dissolved. Bring to boil.
Reduce temperature and simmer while covered. Stir occasionally until liquid is absorbed.

recipes.recipe_description: A vegan, low-calorie dish bursting with flavors.

direction.direction_description: Grind oatmeal using food processor or blender.
Mix oats, cream cheese, and egg whites together.
Heat a non-stick pan to low medium. Take a ladle of the batter and pour it onto the pan
Cook the crêpes for 1-2 minutes on both sides until the edges are done and the middle is no longer liquid.
Transfer top a plate and top with fruits.

recipes.recipe_description: A low-fat breakfast to start your day right.

direction.direction_description: Pre-heat oven at 375°F.
Chop vegetables.
Beat eggs and milk in a bowl. Add vegetables and cheese.
Pour about 2/3 full into lined or sprayed cupcake tins.
Cook in the oven for 15 minutes or until eggs are set.
Can be frozen for future meals if desired.

recipes.recipe_description: The perfect breakfast for busy mornings.

direction.direction_description: Slice sausage into 1/2 inch slices.
Chop peppers, onion, garlic, and celery.
Combine flour and oil in large saucepan until smooth over medium high heat for 3 minutes. Reduce heat to medium and stir for 6-8 minutes or until roux is a dark reddish brown.
Add vegetables. Cook for 8-10 minutes or until tender. Add cajun seasoning.
Pour chicken broth and bring to a boil. Stir for 1 minute. Reduce heat to low.
Add sausage, salt, and pepper. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove cover and bring to a boil. Add shrimp and cook for 3 minutes or until it turns pink.
Ladle gumbo into bowls over rice.

ingredient.ingredient_description: 2 cups chicken broth, bouillon or consomme
15 medium raw peeled and deveined shrimp

recipes.recipe_description: A classic, flavorful Cajun dish.

direction.direction_description: Coarsely chop garlic and sauté in 2 tbsps olive oil.
Add cauliflower, beans, seasonings, and half cup water. Stir and cover. Allow to simmer on low heat.
Cook pasta according to packaging.
Drain pasta and combine with cauliflower-bean mixture. Add the rest of olive oil and mix.
Transfer to plate then serve.

ingredient.ingredient_description: 16 oz dry organic 100% whole wheat fusilli

Slice cheese and place in between bread.
Heat non-stick pan and add sandwich. Toast both sides and melt cheese.

recipes.recipe_description: A quick, high-fiber brunch using only 3 ingredients.

direction.direction_description: Chop banana and freeze for at least an hour.
Place fruits, almond milk, and protein powder in blender to combine. Note: Set aside 2 tbsps mixed berries for later use.
Transfer to a glass and top with remaining berries.

recipes.recipe_description: The perfect drink after workout that's fruity and refreshing.

direction.direction_description: Pre-heat oven at 325°F.
Cream butter and peanut butter. Add sugar, egg, and vanilla.
Add baking and pancake mix by sifting. Stir to incorporate.
Scoop a tablespoon batter and place in lined baking sheet. Repeat until the batter is used up. Flatten with a fork.
Bake for 15 minutes or until edges are light brown. Cool completely before removing from pan with a spatula.

recipes.recipe_description: The perfect treat with salty-sweet taste.

direction.direction_description: Pre-heat oven at 350°F.
Mix dry ingredients together.
Add wet ingredients and stir to incorporate.
Transfer batter to muffin tray. Bake for 20 minutes or perform toothpick test as needed.

recipes.recipe_description: A delightful breakfast or snack with soft, moist texture.

direction.direction_description: Mix all ingredients together in a blender.
Ladle 1/4 cup of mixture and cook in non-stick pan. Repeat until batter is used up.
Transfer to a plate then serve.

ingredient.ingredient_description: 1/2 cup uncooked rolled oats - gluten free

recipes.recipe_description: A guiltless take on everyone's favorite breakfast.

direction.direction_description: Combine milk with vinegar in a medium bowl and set aside for 5 minutes to "sour".
Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large mixing bowl.
Whisk egg and butter into "soured" milk.
Pour the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and whisk until lumps are gone.
Gently fold in blueberries using rubber spatula.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat, and coat with cooking spray. Pour 1/4 cupfuls of batter onto the skillet, and cook until bubbles appear on the surface. Flip with a spatula, and cook until browned on the other side.

recipes.recipe_description: Very easy, very yummy pancakes using basic stuff you already have.

direction.direction_description: Place the rice in a saucepan and rinse in cold water. Set it aside to soak for 30 minutes.
While rice is soaking, slice onions into thin strips. Cut squash and zucchini in half and slice into 1/4" half circles.
Sauté the onions in vegetable oil spread until tender. Add the minced garlic and sauté until the garlic starts to brown.

Add the squash and zucchini and continue to sauté until it is crisp-tender.  Add the tomatoes and heat through.  Season to taste with salt and pepper.  Keep the vegetable mixture warm until ready to serve.

After the rice has soaked for 30 minutes, drain the water and add 1 1/2 cups of cold water. Bring the rice to a boil, cover, reduce heat to its lowest setting and simmer for 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, turn off the heat and let the rice sit covered for an additional 10 minutes.
Scoop the rice into a serving dish.  Top with the vegetable mixture.  Sprinkle shredded mozzarella on top.

ingredient.food_name: Reduced Fat Low Moisture Park Skim Mozzarella Cheese

recipes.recipe_description: A simple medley of summer vegetables in a satisfying vegetarian casserole.

direction.direction_description: Mix all of the ingredients together.
Serve with crackers or with celery.

ingredient.ingredient_description: 2 cups finely shredded sharp cheddar cheese

ingredient.food_name: Original Ranch Seasoning & Salad Dressing Mix

recipes.recipe_description: Cream cheese spread for crackers or celery.

direction.direction_description: Preheat oven to 375 °F (230 °C).  Prepare muffin tins with liners or non-stick spray.
Combine dry ingredients in one bowl and wet ingredients in a second bowl.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and stir to combine.
Spoon batter into 32 muffin tins and cook for 25 minutes. Cool on wire rack.
Note: can be frozen.

ingredient.food_name: Organic 100% Whole Ground Golden Flaxseed Meal

recipes.recipe_description: Soft oatmeal cups for breakfast on the go.

direction.direction_description: In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, sambal oelek, agave nectar, garlic, ginger, honey and sugar. Set aside.
Slice the chicken tenders into 1" segments.
In another bowl, mix together the flour, salt and pepper.
Lightly dredge the chicken in the flour mixture.
Heat the canola oil in a wok or large frying pan. Sauté the chicken in hot oil until it is no longer pink.
Pour the sauce over the chicken and simmer, stirring often, until the sauce is thick and bubbly.
Stir in the cashews. Sprinkle the top with sliced scallions.

ingredient.food_name: Sambal Oelek Ground Fresh Chili Paste

recipes.recipe_description: A tasty chicken stir fry that goes well with rice and vegetables.

direction.direction_description: Saute onion and garlic in coconut oil for 5 minutes
Add chicken stock, carrots and celery and bring to a boil.
Add potatoes and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add Italian seasoning and kale. Cook for 5-10 more minutes.

recipes.recipe_description: Fast kale soup.

direction.direction_description: Squeeze fresh limes.
Mix ingredients.
Serve over ice.

recipes.recipe_description: Classic lime margarita.

direction.direction_description: Toast the whole wheat bread.
Meanwhile, heat 1 tsp vegetable oil spread in a small frying pan. When hot, add egg substitute.
Gently saute the egg substitute until it forms an omelette. Remove from the heat.
Layer the lettuce, omelette, and tomato on 1 piece of toast. Top with the remaining toast, slice, and enjoy.

recipes.recipe_description: A light, tasty, vegetarian sandwich that has no cholesterol.

direction.direction_description: Heat olive oil in fry-pan and add cumin, onions, peppers and corn. Saute til tender.
Add chicken, toss to mix. Cover and cook on low heat.
Meanwhile, place milk in saucepan and whisk in cornstarch on medium heat to thicken. Then add chicken broth and salsa.
Add sauce to vegetable/chicken mixture. Let simmer on low for 15 minutes.
Ladle into bowls. Add salt to taste.

ingredient.food_name: Melange A Trois Red, Yellow & Green Peppers
ingredient.ingredient_description: 1 cup red, yellow and green pepper blend

ingredient.food_name: Hot Chipotle Roasted Tomatillo & Garlic Gourmet Mexican Salsa

ingredient.ingredient_description: 1 1/2 cups skinless chicken breast, cooked, diced

ingredient.food_name: Milk (1% Lowfat with Added Vitamin A)

recipes.recipe_description: A corn chowder with a bit of a kick.

direction.direction_description: In a small saucepan, bring chicken broth, lettuce, mushrooms, and onions to a boil.
Add the ramen noodles and cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the egg substitute to the soup, stirring constantly for about 30 seconds.
Remove from heat and stir in soy sauce and sesame oil.
Note: for a vegetarian version, use vegetable broth instead of chicken broth.

recipes.recipe_description: A quick, satisfying bowl of egg drop soup that has no cholesterol.

direction.direction_description: Separate the egg whites and yolks. Beat the whites until it forms stiff peaks.
Mix 3 oz of cream cheese (it should not be softened) with the egg yolks. There will be slight lumps.
Add 1/2 tsp of vanilla extract and 3 packets of sweetener to the egg yolk mixture and combine thoroughly.

Gently fold the egg whites into the yolk mixture. Don't attempt to mix until it's combined, as that will make the whites deflate. Only combine until they are one. Don't make more than 4 passes with your spatula. You'll see streaks of yellow and white.
Place the remaining cream cheese, vanilla extract and sweetener in a bowl and beat until smooth and creamy.

Spray a cookie sheet with non stick spray and take the egg mixture and create 6 mounds of equal proportion on a cookie sheet. Take equal amounts of the sweetened cream cheese mixture and place in the middle of each 'bun'.

Place the buns in the oven for 30 minutes. Once they're done cooking, let them sit on the cookie sheet for about 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, move to a wire rack and let them sit for 3 hours to let them firm up and 'dry'.
They can be left on the counter for 1 day or stored in an air tight container the fridge for up to 7 days.

recipes.recipe_description: Low carb cream cheese rolls.

direction.direction_description: Sprinkle yeast on 1 1/2 cups lukewarm water in a mixing bowl, stir to dissolve. Add sugar, salt, and stir to dissolve. Add flours, knead dough until smooth and elastic. Let rise at least 1/2 hour.
While the dough is rising, prepare the chicken, bacon bits, ranch, and mozzarella in a bowl. Refrigerate while waiting for the dough to rise.
Prepare a bath of 2 cups warm water and baking soda. Preheat oven to 450 °F (230 °C).

Pinch off bits of the dough, about 2 inches in diameter. Roll the pinched off bits of dough to pie crust thickness. Spread the mixture down the center, leaving room for rolling up the ends. Roll it up like a burrito, pinching the ends closed so nothing gets out, then dip into the bath.
Spray a cookie sheet with non-stick cooking spray. Bake for about 10 minutes until golden brown.
Remove from the pan with a spatula and place on a cookie rack that is on top of a cookie sheet to cool (the cookie sheet will catch butter drippings).
Melt the butter, then glaze lightly over the tops of the pretzel logs. Sprinkle with sea salt.

recipes.recipe_description: Pretzels with filling.

direction.direction_description: In large pot add about 20 cups water.
Chop cabbage into bit size pieces.
Dice onions.
Add bag of cole slaw, carrots, tomato puree, diced tomatoes and seasoning.
Cook down some and add more water if needed.
Note: add whatever spiced you like.

ingredient.food_name: Diced Tomatoes with Basil, Garlic & Oregano (No Salt Added)
ingredient.ingredient_description: 14 1/2 oz no salt added diced tomatoes

recipes.recipe_description: Chopped and shredded cabbage soup.

direction.direction_description: Stir together all ingredients except egg whites.
In a separate bowl whip egg whites into stiff peaks. Fold into bread batter.
Pour by 1/4 cup portions onto hot griddle and turn when the top is set.

ingredient.food_name: Baking Powder (Sodium Aluminum Sulfate, Double Acting)

recipes.recipe_description: Quick cook low carb bread.

direction.direction_description: Wash zucchini and cut in half lengthwise. Using a melon baller or teaspoon scoop out the inside flesh leaving about 1/4 to 3/8" all around making a little "boat".
Chop the scooped out zucchini and the green onions and set aside.
Brown the ground beef and drain well. Add all the spices, zucchini, green onions, and enchilada sauce and simmer all together for 30 minutes on low to low-medium heat. Stir occasionally.
Preheat your oven to 350 °F (175 °C).

Place your prepared zucchini in a 7x11" or 9x13" cake pan lined with foil and sprayed with cooking spray. Drain the meat sauce slightly saving any liquid. Scoop 1/4 to 1/3 cup of the meat mixture. Pour any remaining meat and sauce around the zucchini in the pan. Top with cheese and cover with foil.
Bake at for 30 minutes.
Serve hot with sour cream, salsa, black olives, or other low carb choices.

recipes.recipe_description: Low carb Mexican dish.

direction.direction_description: Break cauliflower into large pieces. In a shallow microwave safe dish, place cauliflower in a single layer.
Add 2 tablespoons of water. Cover with plastic wrap and cook on high in microwave for 4 minutes.
While cauliflower is cooking, mix no carb mayonnaise, mustard, chopped red onion, and cheese in a small bowl.
Uncover bowl carefully and drain water. Sprinkle cauliflower with vinegar.
Smooth cheese mixture on top of cauliflower and cook uncovered for an additional 3 minutes or until tender.

recipes.recipe_description: A tender microwave cauliflower with a tangy, cheesy topping.

direction.direction_description: Chop slaw in a food processor as fine as is your preference (or chop with knife).
In a small bowl, mix mayonnaise, sweetener and apple cider vinegar.
Pour mixture over chopped cabbage. Salt and pepper to taste if desired.

recipes.recipe_description: Low carb cabbage slaw.

direction.direction_description: Fill blender with strawberries.
Cover strawberries with water, add some ice, nectar and whey protein.
Blend well.

recipes.recipe_description: Fresh strawberries and pineapple with whey protein.

direction.direction_description: Brown chicken in sesame oil.
In same pan, add vegetables and soy sauce. Sauté together until vegetables are soft.
Serve over rice.

recipes.recipe_description: Asian style chicken stir-fry.

direction.direction_description: Preheat oven to 350 °F (190 °C).
Slice potatoes into rounds about 1/4" thick and place in large bowl. Steam in microwave (covered) for 3-5 minutes. Check if slightly under fork-tender. Remove and let cool.

In blender or another bowl, Add eggs, green onion, 1/2 the parmesan cheese, romano cheese, evaporated milk and black pepper. Combine well. Add ricotta to mixture and break up with spoon leaving large chunks.

Spray large skillet (at least 12" diameter) with nonstick spray. Arrange softened potato rounds to cover bottom and sides of skillet. Sprinkle with dash salt and black pepper. Arrange cooked bacon crumbles and kale over potatoes (kale has been wilted the day before with sliced garlic and french cut onions). Pour egg mixture over skillet and move around ricotta for even distribution. Sprinkle with remaining parmesan.
Bake for about 30 minutes until golden brown and puffed.
Serve with fruit for breakfast or with a garden salad for lunch.

Note: this is a use-what-you've-got recipe. More bacon, cooked/diced ham or no meat at all. Got a handful of sliced, cooked mushrooms? Toss them in. Use whatever greens you have on hand, kale, chard, spinach, etc.

ingredient.food_name: Uncured Center Cut Reduced Sodium Bacon
ingredient.ingredient_description: 4 slices cooked reduced sodium bacon, crumbled

recipes.recipe_description: An Italian cheese "quiche" (you won't even miss the crust).

direction.direction_description: Mix all dry ingredients then stir in wet ingredients.
Make a thick paste and drop by spoonful's onto greased cookie sheet. Flatten to rounds with greased cup.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 15-20 minutes.

ingredient.food_name: Baking Powder (Sodium Aluminum Sulfate, Double Acting)

recipes.recipe_description: High protein, low carb coconut cookies.

direction.direction_description: Combine all ingredients in a large mason jar with a well-fitting lid. Seal and shake vigorously. (You can also whisk oil into vinegar mixture in a large bowl to emulsify before pouring into jar).
Store refrigerated and it will last 2 weeks or so. Give a good shake before each use.
Note: feel free to experiment. Decrease the oil, use honey in place of turbinado or add more spice with the dried herbs and pepper.

ingredient.ingredient_description: 1 tbsp sweet red peppers, finely minced

recipes.recipe_description: Using fresh ingredients you may never buy the bottled dressing again.

direction.direction_description: Prepare vegetables and arrange in a bowl.
Arrange chicken on top of salad.
Drizzle dressing over salad.
Toss and enjoy.

ingredient.food_name: Roasted Broiled or Baked Chicken Breast

recipes.recipe_description: A mix of salad greens and garden vegetables with leftover roasted chicken.
recipes.recipe_name: Mixed Salad with Roasted Chicken Breast

direction.direction_description: Preheat oven to 425 °F (220 °C).
Cut squash in half, lengthwise.
Use a spoon to scrape out seeds and fibrous innards. Massage olive oil over the open halves and sprinkle evenly with the salt and pepper.
Roast, cut half up, on a foil-lined baking sheet for 40-50 minutes, just until the vegetable begins to take on a little light brown color.
Remove from oven and let cool until easily handled (about 30 minutes). Use a fork to gently scrape/pull the long strands away from the shell.
Use strands as the base to a cold salad or reheat in microwave, if necessary, and stir lightly with fresh parmesan cheese and basil chiffonade for a light side-dish.
Note: roast squash on the weekend and you've got a go-to for a quick turn-around lunch or dinner.

recipes.recipe_description: Oven-roasted spaghetti squash makes a unique side dish or light supper.

direction.direction_description: Mix hot water and sugar in a mixing bowl until mostly dissolved.
Lightly mix yeast into water/sugar solution enough to moisten all the yeast.
Let the mixture stand for 5 minutes. Yeast and sugar will ferment and create a foam. While waiting, melt the butter and set aside.
Add milk and butter to the mixture and slowly start adding flour 1/2 cup at a time into the mixture. Set the mixer on a low setting at first to avoid throwing flour all over the counter.

Continue adding flour until the dough no longer sticks to the side of the bowl. It should be tacky to the touch, but not like bubble gum. Turn the mixer up to a higher setting and beat the dough for about 5 minutes.

Remove the dough from the mixing bowl and lightly coat the bowl with oil (olive oil, vegetable oil, or other). Place the dough back into the mixing bowl and roll the dough around to coat it with the oil. Cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and let it rise for 60 minutes.

Lightly coat a 9x5" bread pan with oil or cake release. After dough has risen for 60 minutes, remove it from the mixing bowl and beat it down flat on the counter. Fold it over and shape it into a loaf (fold in thirds, then fold once more in half). Place the dough into the pan seam side down and let it rise an additional 30 minutes.

Using a serrated knife, carefully cut a slice down the length of the dough.  Place the dough in the oven and turn on the oven to 350 °F (175 °C) (no pre-heating). Let the bread bake for 33-35 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool completely before slicing. Store bread in a sealed container.

ingredient.food_name: Fat Free Skim Milk with Vitamins A & D

ingredient.ingredient_description: 1 oz sweet cream, no salt butter

recipes.recipe_description: A easy to make white bread perfect with lunch or as a snack.

direction.direction_description: Stir fry all ingredients except egg whites and broth for 3 minutes over medium heat.
Add broth and bring to a boil.
Stir in egg white and turn off heat.
Serve immediately.

recipes.recipe_description: Low cal, low carb and delicious.
recipes.recipe_name: Broccoli Egg White Egg Drop Soup

direction.direction_description: Pre-heat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Cook and crumble bacon and stir fry vegetables, no oil.
Whisk eggs and sour cream in a 9" pie plate sprayed with non-stick cooking spray.
Stir in crumbled bacon, vegetables and cheese.
Bake for 30 minutes or until top is golden brown.

ingredient.food_name: Cooked Mushrooms (Fat Not Added in Cooking)
Cooked Red Peppers (Fat Not Added in Cooking)
Nonfat or Fat Free Mozzarella Cheese
ingredient.ingredient_description: 1/4 cup shredded fat free mozzarella cheese

recipes.recipe_description: Easy peasy, delicious bacon, egg and cheese frittata.

direction.direction_description: Dissolve honey and yeast in warm water. Leave for 10 minutes until frothy.
In a large bowl stir flour and salt together. Add yeast mixture and stir with a palette knife until a dough ball forms.

Turn out on to floured surface and knead for 5 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Form a ball and place in a lightly floured large bowl. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and a damp tea cloth. Let dough rise in a warm place for 1 hour, until doubled in size.
Remove dough from bowl and punch down on lightly floured surface. Roll into 12-inch circle and place on a lightly oiled baking sheet, or into a lightly oiled cake pan for pan pizza.
Top with sauce, cheese and any of your favorite toppings and bake in a 450 °F (230 °C) oven for 10-13 minutes until golden.

ingredient.food_name: 2% Reduced Fat Finely Shredded Mozzarella Cheese
ingredient.ingredient_description: 1 1/2 cups reduced fat shredded mozzarella cheese

recipes.recipe_description: This is a homemade pizza made completely from scratch and you can feel good about eating it. Add any toppings you like.

direction.direction_description: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Grease 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
Stir together whole wheat flour, all purpose flour, sugar, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt together in a large mixing bowl.
Add cream style corn, eggs, applesauce, and milk to the flour mixture and stir until just blended.
Fill muffin tins full of batter (to the top, but not overflowing).
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 25-30 minutes.
Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack or serve warm.

Note: try turbinado or brown sugar in place of granulated sugar for more molasses flavor. These muffins go well with any vegetarian chili or meat stew. Be creative...split a muffin, top with shredded BBQ and serve with a green salad for a complete meal.

recipes.recipe_description: Like my grandmother's sweet cornbread with less sugar, a hint of corn niblets and half the fat.

direction.direction_description: Preheat oven to 425 °F (220 °C). Open canned beans and put in colander and rinse well.
Let all water drain from beans and put in large bowl.
Add all seasonings and olive oil. Experiment with the seasonings to your taste. Place in cookie sheet in one layer as much as possible. Place on middle rack.
Bake for 10 minutes. Take out, stir and turn the chickpeas. Put back in oven for 10 more minutes.
Take out chickpeas, stir and turn again. Put oven on broil now on low and put the sheet on top rack for 10 minutes.
Repeat step 5.
Take out chickpeas. Taste one. They should have a distinctive supple "pop" for the crunchiness. If not, then repeat step 5.
Place chickpeas in a bowl and enjoy.

recipes.recipe_description: Spicy broiled/baked chickpeas, with a lovely pop of a crunch. Addicting and delicious.

direction.direction_description: Combine all ingredients.
Stir.
Put in cake pan.
Bake at 375 °F (190 °C) for 25 minutes.

ingredient.food_name: The Dark Chocolate Lover's Chocolate Bar

recipes.recipe_description:
Indulge in this scrumptious treat and still stay on track to your fitness goals. 
Helps keep those cravings in check.

direction.direction_description: Toast oats in oven for about 10 minutes until light brown.
Add oats to a bowl with toffee bits, sunflower seeds, raisins, cranberries, and chia seeds.
Melt butter in pot with sugar and honey, stir well until sugar is fully dissolved, add vanilla and almond extract and stir well.
Pour wet mixture into dry mixture and mix together very well.
Press mixture into parchment paper lined pan or silicone pan. Press down very well and put in refrigerator for 2 hours, remove and cut in desired shape.

recipes.recipe_description: A homemade granola bar with raisins, sunflower seed kernels and much more.
